detaileddescription.para: unreliable calibration status of linear acceleration
low calibration status of linear acceleration
medium calibration status of linear acceleration
high calibration status of linear acceleration
enum that defines calibration status of linear acceleration
data type for linear acceleration g data
Defines the handle for linear acceleration object. This handle is required for the initialisation of linear acceleration
custom data types for linear acceleration data data type for linear acceleration lsb data
data type for linear acceleration m/s2 data

simplesect.para: This API needs to be called when we require to stop the linear acceleration data reading.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

briefdescription.para: Initializes the linear acceleration sensor sensor.

parameterdescription.para: the handle to the linear acceleration sensor object that should be initialized
In case of invalid sensor handle.
If called without initializing the sensor.

simplesect.para: This API needs to be called before calling any other function of the linear acceleration sensor.
Refer #XdkSensorHandle.h for selecting the proper handle.
The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

briefdescription.para: Reads 'g' xyz values from linear acceleration.

parameterdescription.para: output parameter in which the linear acceleration data will be written to, from within the function
Reading linear acceleration 'g' xyz value success.
If called without initializing the sensor.
In case linearAccelerationData is NULL pointer.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

briefdescription.para: Reads 'LSB' xyz values from linear acceleration.

parameterdescription.para: output parameter in which the linear acceleration data will be written to, from within the function
Reading linear acceleration xyzLsb value success.
If called without initializing the sensor.
In case linearAccelerationData is NULL pointer.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.

briefdescription.para: Reads 'm/(s^2)' xyz values from linear acceleration.

parameterdescription.para: output parameter in which the linear acceleration data will be written to, from within the function
Reading linear acceleration 'm/(s^2)' xyz value success.
If called without initializing the sensor.
In case linearAccelerationData is NULL pointer.

simplesect.para: The return value consist of (First 1 MSByte represents Package ID, Next Byte represents Severity and Last 2 LSBytes represents error code).
Pass the return value of this function to #BCDS_getUserErrorCode() API to know the user type return code present in #BCDS_SensorErrorType.h.
